Risk.1. Instability: Unstable terrain, crumbling cover, unpredictable allies or enemies
Risk.2. Impact: Direct injury, gunfire, explosives, kinetic trauma
Risk.3. Containment: Being pinned, flanked, or cornered without exit
Risk.4. Deprivation: Ammo shortage, medical supply loss, food/water scarcity
Risk.5. Proximity: Close-quarters combat or risk of enemy breach
Risk.6. Obstruction: Broken equipment, blocked routes, friendly fire lines

Relation.1. Communication: Comms, hand signals, squad-level intel sharing
Relation.2. Trust: Confidence in unit cohesion and chain of command
Relation.3. Disclosure: Mission briefings, intelligence leaks, or misdirection
Relation.4. Reciprocity: Covering fire, medical support, shared objectives
Relation.7. Boundaries: Rules of engagement, ROE zones, leadership hierarchy

Reward.1. Gain: Territory secured, mission success, gear acquisition
Reward.2. Clarity: Confirmed objectives, intel gathered, situational awareness
Reward.3. Recognition: Command praise, public honor, military distinction
Reward.4. Mastery: Improved marksmanship, tactical fluency, mission adaptability
Reward.6. Alignment: Mission congruence with values, protection of civilians or allies
Reward.7. Progress: Advancement through campaign, leveling, or strategic goals

Risk.1. Abandonment: Being left behind in combat or forgotten by command
Risk.2. Entrapment: Caught in kill zones, mines, or collapsing buildings
Risk.4. Imbalance: Feeling outgunned, outnumbered, or emotionally fatigued
Risk.6. Repetition: Flashbacks, trauma loops, déjà vu scenarios
Risk.7. Disintegration: Loss of self in chaos, breakdown of mental state

Relation.1. Attachment: Bonds with squadmates, commanders, or fallen comrades
Relation.2. Mirroring: Absorbing unit morale, mimicry under stress
Relation.3. Enmeshment: Losing self in role or identity of 'soldier'
Relation.4. Resonance: Emotional sync with environment — fear, anger, resolve
Relation.5. Abandonment Sensitivity: Heightened panic when separated from team
Relation.6. Unspoken Expectation: Knowing what to do without orders
Relation.7. Energetic Memory: Haunting sense of previous missions or kills

Reward.1. Safety: Extraction secured, enemy eliminated, base reinforced
Reward.2. Belonging: Being part of the unit, understood without speaking
Reward.3. Relief: Surviving an assault, finding cover, getting resupplied
Reward.4. Soothing: Night watch calm, campfire talk, trusted rituals
Reward.5. Recognition (Unspoken): Silent nods, shared trauma, earned respect
Reward.6. Continuity: Living to fight another day, identity as a soldier preserved
Reward.7. Permission: Emotional release — to cry, rest, rage, or act

Risk.3. Exposure: Cowardice revealed, failure captured on cam or log
Risk.5. Dependence: Relying on weaker allies or foreign support
Risk.7. Contradiction: Orders violating personal code or image

Relation.2. Hierarchy: Respect based on chain of command and authority
Relation.3. Influence: Ability to direct action, sway battlefield decisions
Relation.4. Dependency: Team leaning on player’s leadership or kill count
Relation.6. Possession: Weapon personalization, call-sign branding, turf defense
Relation.7. Projection: Blaming new recruits, foreign troops, 'the brass'

Reward.2. Admiration: Respect from squad, stream audiences, and command
Reward.3. Influence: Control over squad strategy or broader tactical picture
Reward.6. Autonomy: Rogue ops, lone wolf play, rule-bending advantage
Reward.7. Exclusivity: Access to elite missions, special gear, restricted zones
